Friendly staff pleasant grounds tasty food. Pros. The staff was vey friendly and helpful. The grounds were quite extensive and wel landscaped including a firepit. The Broad Street Grilles food was a good quality at both breakfast and dinner. This location is within easy walking distance of the Convention Center which was the hub of our activities. Some rooms not mine must have a good view of Lookout Mountain. Cons. The hotel has no airport shuttle which makes it expensive to get to. There is not much to do within walking distance and the electric shuttle does not pass by the hotel. The beds like many hotels I have stayed in recently must have some sort of plastic mattress pad that generates heat and makes it hot to sleep in. This combined with the new trend to give you only one layer of covers makes for a night of throwing off the covers and putting them back on again. They could offer more snacks and persoanl items for sale since the nearest drugstore is on the northside.

Nice clean hotel but very dark and boring on a we d. very clean hotel with a nice pool and spa. sidewalk cafe was closed when we arrived. The broadstret grill was the worst rest i ve ever eaten at in Chattanooga. waiters were unatentive. never took a drink order did not ask if we needed appetizers or deserts after the meal. The food would have been better cooked at a waffle house. It also stormed while there. very common in the afternoons in Chattanooga. The in room tv was always out during these long storms. The pool and spa area. not much around the hotel except an expensive warehouse district. Lots to do and places to eat a couple miles towards the riverfront. The restaurant needs much improvement on the menu and staff professionalism.

My only choice in Chattanooga. The Chatanogan is so much more than a hotel. The hotel itself is very comfortable and has the best guest service. The front entrance has a park like setting. Old trees pathways firepit and always friendly employees to greet you at the door. The lobby is almost like a small town in itself with lots to offer right on the property a restaurant a bar a coffee shop. We were traveling w a small child and really enjoyed just walking around in thentrance park or around the expansive lobby. The indoor pool and gym were great. The rooms were wonderful and we will enjoyed our location in Chattanooga. The rental bike stand is right out the back door.
Best hotel for the area. Nice hotel for Chattanooga situated in a central location close to most activities.
Top notch facility friendly helpful staff. Day Spa pool exercise equipment. Personal recommendation.

Got ta a really good price from online booking site. Only there for one night for concert at the Tivoli Theater. Nice location. Walking distance to free shuttle and other attractions restaurants nearby. Check in easy desk staff very friendly. Room nice clean. Pretty much average room. A c nice and cool. Nice view out windows. Parking price not bad considering location. Pool clean 35 feet max depth good for kids. Jacuzi gym and sauna. Real nice roof deck area adjacent to pool. Only there for one night so did not eat at any of the in hotel restaurants. Got a couple drinks from the bar. Very nice interior. Beautiful hotel overall. Not crazy about hold on credit debit card even when room paid for in advance. If we got another good rate we had stay again.
Clean and comfortable. Hard to get an extra towel for the pool. But the pool and exercise center were clean and up to date.

Terrific place to relax and unwind. My daughter and I wanted a 4day getaway less than a 3 hour drive from Atlanta and found our way to the Chatanogan. The weather was cold but the hotel was such a warm and friendly environment that we did not leave the hotel for the 3 days we were there. We brought jigsaw puzzles sat by the huge fireplace and puzzled the whole time. In between we ate and drank at the wonderful restaurant and friendly bar area and even got in a few games of pool in the rec area. Overall it was a great relaxing trip that we intend to repeat every year. What a great find.
The staff at the spa was awesome. The rooms needed vacuuming and a little more cleaning. Great area.

We spent 259 to stay at this hotel. It took approximately 15 minutes to check in and we were sent to a room with two double beds. We came back downstairs and were told. Oh yeah I thought I sent you to the wrong room. It took an additional 15 minutes to get a room key to the correct room. There was mold and mildew in the bathroom cracks in the tile hair on the nightstand etc. Trying to not trip on carpet that is sticking up throughout the hotel is like a local obstacle course. The phone did not work when we were ready to request our vehicle and so on. This was not a good experience. Save your money and go to an AirBNB or other hotel.
Exceptional. Sauna and steam room. The gym needs updated equipment that actually work.

Good. Restaurants in building. Pool and spa on 2nd floor translates normally quiet end of hall room into loud entrance for half the hotel to access recreation. High end hotel price but plastic and paper cups in room.

The best part about this hotel was it is walkability. Lots of nice restaurants within walking distance and the main touristy attractions less than a ten minute drive. I did not like having to pay 9 a day for parking nor the policy they have in place. The parking fee comes out of the hold they place on your credit card. The bathroom tub grout was less than clean and the check in process was extended because there was only one employee at the desk who was clearly overwhelmed with a ringing phone. If check in is at 4 pm for everyone it should be safe to assume there would be more staff at the desk to help. This was short stay but the amenities looked nice enough from a glance. Though the spa was really a corned off area near the changing areas for the pool and gym.

Very nice beautiful hotel kind and courteous staff. Great water pressure in the showers. Clean well decorated inviting atmosphere. I was here to attend a conference and found all of the conference rooms to be clean and nicely appointed. There is a workout room and a gym as part of the spa that guests have access to from 60 am to 10 pm there is also an on site parking garage with self parking and valet service. Great neighborhood with dozens of wonderful restaurants within walking distance. My only mild complaint is the nightly rate which seems a bit high compared to other similarly sized USA cities. Other than that I had a lovely stay.
fitness center in construction was only criticism. Other thsn that the stay was excellent.

4 night stay. Nice staff clean sheets clean bathroom working elevator. WiFi did n’t work in the room they moved me 3 rooms until we found one that had WiFi but was in a lower floor with a smaller room. It was missing a desk lamp which originally had. They sent someone up with a lamp but he told me that the room is n’t supposed to have another lamp even though he was holding it in his hand. He then suggested I move the floor lamp next to the desk. Finally agreed to let me have the lamp though there was n’t much room for it on the smaller desk. All I wanted was a room with working WiFi and a working desk with some light. It took me almost a full evening dealing with that. Besides that it was fine. The fitness center was n’t really a fitness center just a room on the first floor with some weights a bench treadmill and cycling machine. Not even a water cooler. I ’m ok with that it ’s the WiFI issue which annoyed me the most.

Great hotel for a Chattanooga girls trip. Location was great for our girls trip quick and inexpensive Uber trip anywhere. Breakfast in the hotel was wonderful. The spa and spa staff were top notch. The only thing that did not live up to expectations was the sauna in the spa did not work and was very small for one maybe two people. During our trip the hotel was undergoing renovations so this could be potentially fixed with the new spa. Overall we enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel to fellow travellers. The sauna advertised online was very disappointing. However this did not take away for our experience.

Not What I Thought very disappointed. This is NOT a place 4 business Travelers. Breakfast is 1750 and no complimentary Coffee or anything. The gym is small as a closet. Business Center and pool out of service. My wife worked in the lobby waiting for the room to be cleaned. It took till almost 3 pm for the maid service and she had to find a maid in the hallway to get them to clean it. One disappointment after another. The double bed rooms are full size not queen. We asked for a King but they said no can do. I will not be staying here for my future business trips. Hilton Garden inn it is.
